description: This video is the second part of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, continuing the tutorial on creating an energy blast effect.

name: Niagara VFX Crash Course 05: Energy Blast Part 1
description: This video is the first part of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, focusing on how to create an energy blast effect.

name: Niagara VFX Crash Course 04: Cryogenic Smoke
description: This video is part 4 of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, focusing on creating a cryogenic smoke effect.

name: Niagara VFX Crash Course 03: Introduction to Niagara Fluids
description: This video is part 3 of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, providing an introduction to Niagara Fluids for beginners.

name: Niagara VFX Crash Course 02: Introduction to Particles
description: This video is part 2 of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, providing an introduction to particles for beginners.

name: Niagara VFX Crash Course 01: Preparing Unreal Engine Project
description: This video is the first part of the Niagara VFX Crash Course, covering the preparation of an Unreal Engine project.

name: How To Use GitHub With Unreal Engine | Unreal Engine Remote Team Projects Collaboration
description: This tutorial shows how to set up Unreal Engine and GitHub for remote team collaboration on projects in Unreal Engine 4 or 5. It covers downloading and installing necessary tools like Git Console and Git LFS, setting up the project, pushing changes, publishing repositories, and adding collaborators. The video also explains how team members can access the project and manage pushing and pulling changes.

name: 35 UE5 Features You Probably Don't Know About | Unreal Fest 2022
description: This recorded session from Unreal Fest 2022 highlights 35 lesser-known Unreal Engine 5 features that can significantly accelerate project development. Chris Murphy, an Unreal Engine Evangelist, demonstrates how these features can reduce development time from weeks to days.

name: Pickup and drop system with physics on UE5
description: This tutorial teaches how to create a pickup and drop system with physics in Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). It covers importing and scaling a 3D model, implementing a blueprint to pick up and drop a gun using physics, and setting up collision for the pistol. The video also guides through the pickup and detach logic, concluding with a demonstration of the final result.

name: How to Make a Simple Pick Up System in Unreal Engine 5 - Beginner Tutorial
description: This quick and simple tutorial demonstrates how to create a basic pick-up system in Unreal Engine 5. It teaches users how to grab and equip items and weapons from the ground onto their character.

name: How To Toggle Between Third Person And First Person Camera Perspective In Unreal Engine 5 (Tutorial)
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to toggle between third-person and first-person camera perspectives in Unreal Engine 5. It guides users through changing camera views within their game.

name: Unreal Engine + Kinect for Immersive Experiences
description: This video explores building immersive projects using Unreal Engine and Kinect, integrating additional software like TouchDesigner to route Kinect control channels as OSC messages to Unreal. In Unreal, it shows how to set up Niagara particle systems, a cinematic camera, and blueprints to transform object positions using OSC messages. The tutorial includes Chop Execute DAT Code from TouchDesigner and an Unreal OSC Blueprint for practical implementation.

name: Mejora Tus Cinematicas En Unreal Engine 5 (O Cualquier Otro Programa 3D)
description: This video analyzes factors that contribute to a more "cinematic" 3D render in Unreal Engine 5 or other 3D programs. It covers disabling post-process effects, understanding anamorphic cameras, configuring them in UE 5.2, selecting appropriate aspect ratios and lenses, and setting FPS and resolution. The tutorial also discusses post-editing effects and provides a list of top cinematography learning resources.

name: Google Earth en Unreal Engine 5 ¬°Importa Cualquier Ciudad del Mundo!
description: This tutorial teaches how to import any city or terrain from the world into Unreal Engine 5 using the Google Earth API and the Cesium plugin. It covers plugin installation, creating a Cesium account, obtaining the Google API key, configuring URLs, generating the initial environment, and considerations for generating specific cities.

name: How to Make a Simple Behavior Tree in Unreal Engine 5 - Advanced AI
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to create a simple AI using Behavior Trees in Unreal Engine 5. It covers advanced AI concepts and provides references to other tutorials for simple enemy AI, blendspace, and animal AI.

name: Adding Modular Clothing for Metahuman. Tutorial UE5
description: This tutorial demonstrates a simple method for setting up and customizing modular clothing for Metahumans in Unreal Engine 5. It covers adding Metahumans to a project, incorporating individual clothing pieces, creating new clothing nodes, applying opacity masks to body parts, and showcasing default animations.

name: Getting Started With Action API In Unreal Engine
description: This tutorial guides users on how to get started with and use the Action API in Unreal Engine, recommending watching the Unreal quick start video first. It provides step-by-step instructions on implementing actions such as move, stop, wait, pick up, drop, and color change. The video explains how to change the default pawn class to enable movement, add new actions and functions by editing the companion blueprint, and concludes with practical examples and a deep dive into the companion blueprint.

name: 5 Tricks you (probably) don't know about Unreal Engine 5
description: This tutorial reveals five easy tricks in Unreal Engine 5 that are beneficial for beginners. It aims to help users master filmmaking, video editing, and VFX within a single bundle.

name: how to fix metahuman hair disappearing in Unreal Engine 5
description: This video shows how to fix the issue of Metahuman hair disappearing in Unreal Engine 5. It provides solutions for common problems related to Metahuman hair visibility in the engine.

name: Unreal Engine 5 - Ultimate Voice AI Tutorial - Masterclass from scratch
description:
This masterclass provides a comprehensive guide to setting up a voice AI system in Unreal Engine 5 from scratch. It explains how to use a microphone for communication with an NPC/AI and receive a voice response using ChatGPT and Elevenlabs TTS. The tutorial covers requirements, limitations, project setup, speech recognition, ChatGPT communication, bug fixing, enabling ChatGPT to remember context, and Elevenlabs TTS integration.

It notes that Runtime Audio Importer and Speech Recognizer plugins are no longer free on the marketplace but can still be downloaded from GitHub. Project files are available for patrons.

name: How To Properly Export From Blender To Unreal Without Losing Textures
description: This tutorial shows how to properly export a mesh or model from Blender and import it into Unreal Engine 4 or 5 without losing textures or data. It specifically addresses and resolves the common issue of materials appearing white upon import into Unreal using an FBX file.

name: (Easy) Blender To Unreal Engine 5
description: This tutorial offers an easy guide to transferring models from Blender to Unreal Engine 5. It covers quick export/import methods, Blender export options, importing into Unreal, and setting up a Cine-Camera. The video also addresses and fixes common pivot issues, presenting a correct workflow for integration.

name: Custom clothes for UE Metahuman / UE 5 / Blender 4+ /MarvelousDesigner 11
description: This video provides a streamlined workflow for adding custom clothes to Metahuman characters in Unreal Engine 5 using Blender 4+ and Marvelous Designer 11. It's designed as a step-by-step clickthrough rather than a deep dive into creating clothes or weight painting.

name: Conversational AI in Unreal Engine Quick Setup Guide | MetaHumans, ReadyPlayerMe, and more | Convai
description: This quick setup guide demonstrates how to configure Convai's Unreal Engine plugin and utilize its demo project for conversational AI with MetaHumans, ReadyPlayerMe, and other avatars. It directs users to the Convai website to create their own characters and provides information on accessing the UE plugin.

name: The Fastest Way to Learn Lighting in UE5
description: This video offers a fast way to learn lighting in Unreal Engine 5, focusing on a lighting study exercise to improve cinematic and short film lighting. It explains a simple framework for matching photograph lighting, basics of Directional Lights, Sky Lights, and Dynamic Lighting in UE5. The tutorial also covers creating a lighting study, distinguishing between sunny and overcast lighting, and cinematic lighting techniques.

name: Tutorials: how to use the plugin
description: This tutorial details how to use the MetaHuman SDK plugin in Unreal Engine, an automated AI solution for generating realistic character animations. It covers integrating TTS, adding audio for lip sync (both standard and streaming), integrating a chatbot, and combining these functionalities into a single combo request.

name: Tutorial: Metahuman's Head Detachment Fix
description: This tutorial provides steps to fix the MetaHuman's head detachment issue from the body in Unreal Engine. It guides users through the necessary steps to resolve this common problem.

name: How to Connect Head and Body Animations to MetaHumans without Sequencer
description: This video is a continuation of a previous tutorial, focusing on connecting head and body animations to MetaHumans without using Sequencer.

name: How to HIDE Texture REPETITION in Unreal Engine - UE4 Tutorial
description: This Unreal Engine 4 tutorial provides four tips to hide texture repetition on landscapes, a common issue that degrades visual quality. It covers using good textures, adding macro variation, blending texture size with distance, and varying materials to achieve photorealistic landscapes. This is the first part of a series on creating photorealistic landscapes.

name: Unreal 5.1 and 5.2 Meta Human Retarget to Third person character
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to retarget a MetaHuman character to a Third Person character in Unreal Engine 5.1 and 5.2.

name: MetaHuman Animator Complete Guide for Head Rotation and Body Attachment
description: This complete guide for MetaHuman Animator covers using upgraded 5.2 MetaHumans, exporting head animations with and without head rotation, and attaching head animations to a body. It also includes a bonus section on using neck data from MHA instead of just head rotation.

name: How to retarget Unreal 5 Mannequin animations to a MetaHuman (Tutorial)
description: This tutorial explains how to retarget MoCap Central UE5 mannequin animations to a MetaHuman using Unreal 5.2. It covers locating the MetaHuman proportion skeleton type, creating a new UE5 to MetaHuman Retargeter file, turning off Blend to Source in Retargeter, and reviewing/exporting retargeted MetaHuman animations.

name: How To Fix Metahuman Detached Head in Unreal Engine 5
description: This tutorial shows how to fix the detached or floating head issue with Metahumans in Unreal Engine 5 when applying animation in Sequencer using Livelink. It explains why this occurs and provides a quick resolution method. The video covers understanding Metahuman skeletons, the reason for detachment, and how to fix it in Take Recorder.

name: Metahuman Disappearing Hair Fix
description: This quick tutorial explains how to adjust LOD settings in Unreal Engine 5.03 (also works in 5.1) to prevent Metahuman character hair from disappearing in the viewport.

name: UE5 preview 2 Fixing MetaHumans Issues Part 3
description: This is part 3 of a series by Gabriel Paiva, an authorized Unreal Instructor, focusing on fixing MetaHumans issues in Unreal Engine 5 preview 2. He shares news and tutorials related to Unreal Engine.

name: UE5 preview 2 Fixing MetaHumans Issues Part 2
description: This is part 2 of a series by Gabriel Paiva, an authorized Unreal Instructor, focusing on fixing MetaHumans issues in Unreal Engine 5 preview 2. He shares news and tutorials related to Unreal Engine.

name: UE5 preview 2 Fixing MetaHumans Issues Part 1
description: This is part 1 of a series by Gabriel Paiva, an authorized Unreal Instructor, focusing on fixing MetaHumans issues in Unreal Engine 5 preview 2. He shares news and tutorials related to Unreal Engine.

name: Another Way to Combine Face and Body Animations - Metahumans in Unreal Engine 5
description: This tutorial presents an alternative method to combine Metahuman Face and Body animations in Sequencer within Unreal Engine 5. It provides a solution for integrating these animations.

name: How to make Cinematic animation inside Unreal Engine 5 II Tutorial II UE5
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to create cinematic animations within Unreal Engine 5. It guides viewers through the process of producing high-quality cinematic sequences.

name: Simple Exporting With the Movie Render Queue - Unreal Engine 5
description: This quick tutorial explains how to export a render from Unreal Engine 5 using the Movie Render Queue. It also mentions additional resources for combining rendered image sequences and exporting as MP4 or AVI video files.

name: FK vs IK (Explained in 25 seconds)
description: This quick video explains the difference between FK (Forward Kinematics) and IK (Inverse Kinematics) and when to use each. It serves as an infographic for animators.

name: Audio2Face to MetaHuman | How to Animate MetaHuman using Audio2Face Live Link | Unreal Engine 5.2
description: This video demonstrates how to animate a MetaHuman using NVIDIA Omniverse Audio2Face Real-Time Facial Animation in Unreal Engine 5.2. It covers installing the new Omniverse Live Link Plugin to achieve real-time facial animation. The tutorial also highlights other tools like iClone 8 and Character Creator 4.

name: Dive into Source Control in Unreal Engine | Webinar
description: This webinar delves into source control options within the Unreal Editor, focusing on risk reduction and enhanced collaboration for Unreal Engine projects. It covers the fundamentals of source control for managing versions of Levels, Materials, Blueprints, C++ code, and other content. The presentation specifically discusses Git, Perforce, Subversion, and Plastic SCM.

name: Source Control in Unreal Engine for dummies. Why is it different from incremental saving.
description: This video explains source control in Unreal Engine for beginners, clarifying why it differs from incremental saving and file syncing services like Dropbox. It breaks down the basic principles of source control and how it facilitates frictionless collaboration on Unreal Engine projects.

name: Metahuman Animator Part 2: Fixing detached floating head & rendering
description:
This is the second part of a MetaHuman Animator tutorial for Unreal Engine 5.2, focusing on combining facial performance capture with a full Metahuman body. It covers a cut/paste workflow between control rigs and retargeting animations from UE Mannequin.

The tutorial addresses the issue of detached floating heads by providing a workaround that stitches head keyframes to the body, unlike other solutions that failed for the creator. It also covers preparing for animation with camera and sequence, adding to the movie render queue, and rendering parameters, concluding with the animation result and final thoughts.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Head Reattachment Tutorial | Metahuman Animator
description: This tutorial shows the correct way to reattach a Metahuman's head to its body in Unreal Engine 5 after applying an animation performance, especially when using Live Link. It explains why the head detaches and provides an easy solution for seamless character animation.

name: Tutorial: Configurar Visual Studio para Unreal Engine 5.X
description: This video explains how to configure Visual Studio for Unreal Engine 5.x, enabling the transition from Blueprints to C++ programming. It covers downloading and installing Visual Studio Community, configuring options for UE, identifying within Visual Studio, and installing the Unreal Visual Studio Integration Tool plugin. The tutorial then guides through creating a C++ project in Unreal Engine, performing a first compilation, activating the plugin, using an example code, and creating the first C++ Actor class to test UE_LOG.

name: MetaHuman Animator Tutorial | Unreal Engine 5
description: This step-by-step guide for Unreal Engine's MetaHuman Animator shows how to set up an iPhone with the LiveLink app for high-fidelity facial motion capture. It covers connecting the phone to a computer, setting up the project in UE5, importing footage, calibration, and processing the animation. The tutorial also demonstrates how to add and blend face and body animations for a Metahuman.

name: Our Studio was a HUGE waste of money - New Channel Launch!
description: This video discusses the challenges of limited studio space for multiple channels and how green screen technology with BlackMagic Ultimatte 12 helps overcome this by enabling live compositing. It touches on motion tracking and the capabilities and limitations of the setup for video production.

name: 7. Creaci√≥n de Personajes MetaHuman y Unreal 5 ‚ù§Ô∏è Curso de Videojuegos con UNREAL 5 GRATIS
description: This video is part of a free Unreal Engine 5 video game course, focusing on creating MetaHuman characters. It highlights MetaHuman Creator's ability to generate photorealistic digital humans with extensive customization. The video addresses how to create, modify, integrate, and export these digital humans for video games or films.

name: Ultimate, ultimate, ultimate MIDI Tutorial with Unreal Engine (PART 1) R1
description: This is the first part of an extensive MIDI tutorial with Unreal Engine, delving deep into the MIDI protocol library. It is a key piece in a series about motion control with Unreal Engine, covering the basics of the MIDI protocol and part of the MIDI Library in Unreal Engine. All projects will be hosted on GitHub.

name: Live Link Face Animation for Metahuman in Unreal Engine 5. [Step by Step Guide]
description: This step-by-step tutorial shows how to use Live Link to record MetaHuman facial animation in Unreal Engine 5. It covers installing the Live Link app on an iPhone (iPhone X or above), connecting the phone to the computer, setting up Unreal Engine, adding the Metahuman model, and recording facial animation. The video concludes with a demonstration of the results.

name: Kame House en Blender, Substance Painter y Unreal Engine 5 ::: Parte 1
description: This tutorial series teaches the workflow between Blender and Unreal Engine 5 to create the iconic Kame House. It also includes using Substance Painter for texturing the house. The series is sponsored by NVIDIA GeForce LA.

name: Exploring the Virtual Production Visualization Guide : Live From LA Lab!
description: This video teaches the basics of virtual production visualization from experts, drawing on studio insights to offer production-proven tips. It covers core concepts so users can begin experimenting with virtual production using an iOS device, Unreal Engine, and a computer. The content is derived from the Virtual Production Visualization Guide.

name: WHAT IS THIS MAGIC? NERF - LUMA AI TO UNREAL ENGINE 5.1 ( AND WHY IT'S BETTER THAN PHOTO SCANNING)
description: This video explores how to capture real-world 3D objects and environments using Neural Radiance Fields (NERF) and import them into Unreal Engine. It suggests that NERF can yield significantly better results than traditional photo scanning.

name: Tutorial: Unreal Engine ChatGPT with Metahuman SDK
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to integrate ChatGPT (a GPT artificial neural network) with MetaHuman SDK in Unreal Engine, allowing for more natural and productive dialogue. It shows how to use ChatGPT with the plugin, providing a blueprint for implementation.

name: Lighting in Unreal Engine 5 for Beginners
description:
This tutorial is for beginners learning lighting in Unreal Engine 5, addressing the challenges of achieving correct lighting. It covers the fundamentals of light, types of lights available, and how to maximize their use. The video deeply explains real-world light behavior and how to mimic it in Unreal.

It demonstrates lighting an environment from scratch for both daytime and overcast, moody looks. The tutorial also includes quick tips on reflective objects and emissive materials.

name: State of Unreal | GDC 2023 | Epic Games - ESRB: RP to M
description: This video provides a glimpse into the future of game development and the Epic ecosystem from GDC 2023's State of Unreal. It showcases new projects and dives into the latest Epic tech, featuring presentations by Epic Games and their partners.

name: SWITCH CAMERA en directo para tu producci√≥n virtual || Unreal Engine 5.1
description: This video teaches how to create a live camera switching system for virtual production in Unreal Engine 5.1. It covers programming fixed and moving cameras to enable real-time switching for an impactful visual experience.

name: ChatGPT inside Unreal Engine 5, my new executive assistant!
description: This video demonstrates how to download and set up the free "HttpGPT-ChatGPT integrated in the Engine" plugin with Unreal Engine 5. It showcases ChatGPT's functionality within the engine.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Metahuman Animation Tutorial
description: This tutorial provides a guide on animating MetaHumans in Unreal Engine 5. It covers various aspects of Metahuman animation, including Control Rig, animation libraries, and retargeting from sources like Mixamo. The video addresses questions about Metahumans being free and game-ready.

name: UE5 C++ Basics #1 - Structs, Variables
description:
This first part of a UE5 C++ Basics series demonstrates how to use C++ in Unreal Engine 5 to enhance game performance, noting its speed advantage over Blueprints for heavy or frequent tasks. It covers creating a project with a C++ template, defining custom C++ classes and structs, and using macros like USTRUCT() and UPROPERTY().

The tutorial also explains essential class requirements, managing Live Coding, and exposing C++ structs for use in Blueprints, aiming to provide a solid foundation for C++ development in Unreal.

name: Combining body and facial animations for Metahuman in Unreal Engine 5
description: This tutorial demonstrates a method for combining body and facial animations for Metahumans in Unreal Engine 5 (specifically UE 5.0.3) without using a control rig or losing head rotations. It addresses the common issue of losing head rotation when integrating external animations with Live Link facial captures.

name: Combine Face and Body Animations - Metahumans in Unreal Engine 5 .1
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to combine Metahuman face and body animations in Sequencer within Unreal Engine 5.1 without losing head rotation from the facial mocap. It presents a controllable solution that allows switching between a fixed and original body-driven head animation, building upon a fix from EllieJayLiquid.

name: Mixamo and Metahumans in Sequencer
description: This tutorial explains the basics of using Mixamo animations, retargeted to a Metahuman in a sequence. It also demonstrates how to mix facial animations with body animation. The video includes resources for Mixamo to UE5 workflows and IK Retargeting documentation.

name: UE5 C++ 1 - How To Read and Write Text Files with C++? - Unreal Engine Tutorial Editor CPP
description: This Unreal Engine C++ tutorial demonstrates how to easily read and write text files using FPlatformFileManager and FFileHelper functions. It covers setting up the header, reading a file, writing to a file, and testing the functionality.

name: UE5 C++ Enhanced Input - 4 - Using Two Dimensional Input Actions
description: This video, part 4 of the UE5 C++ Enhanced Input series, teaches how to use two-dimensional Input Actions. Specifically, it demonstrates how to control the camera with the mouse.

name: UE5 C++ Enhanced Input - 1 - Core Concepts and Documentation
description: This first video in the UE5 C++ Enhanced Input series introduces core concepts and documentation. It aims to explain all the foundational elements of Enhanced Input in Unreal Engine 5 C++.

name: The Ultimate Guide to SNAPPING in Unreal Engine! (Place Objects Quickly and Accurately)
description: This video provides the ultimate guide to using the snapping system in Unreal Engine for quick, easy, and accurate object placement. It covers grid snapping for placing walls, rotational snapping for objects, creating copies along an arc, and snapping objects to surfaces. The tutorial also explains how to use align to surface normal and vertex snapping, as well as setting a pivot point to a vertex.

name: Move Ai | Complete Guide to Getting Setup
description: This tutorial provides a complete step-by-step guide on setting up multiple iPhones for motion capture using Move.ai. It covers connecting iPhones to a host device, iPhone troubleshooting tips, tripod setup, and calibration for accurate motion capture data.

name: How to Push Unreal Projects to GitHub | Unreal Engine 5
description: This video provides a quick guide on how to push Unreal Engine 5 projects to GitHub. It covers creating an Unreal Project, setting up a repository on GitHub Desktop, publishing the repository, copying Unreal project files locally, committing to main, and pushing to GitHub's cloud.

name: Creating a photorealistic rain scene in Unreal Engine | lumen tutorial
description: This tutorial offers a full breakdown of the workflow for creating a photorealistic rain scene in Unreal Engine, focusing on Lumen. It covers location scouting, car animation, lighting techniques, creating realistic rain, and establishing ambient atmosphere. The video also includes a bonus tool for cinematic fog and console variables for optimization.

name: How to use the Modeling Tools in UE5 and UEFN: Sculpting
description:
This tutorial demonstrates how to use Unreal Engine's sculpting tools in UE5 and UEFN to create organic structures like an bridge. It covers dynamic sculpting mode, using orthographic views for control, changing brush size, and employing vertex sculpting tools.

The video also explains how to create and apply a WorldCoordinate3way material for seamless texture projection on objects without UVs, and for removing seams between overlapping objects.

name: Mixamo to UE5 : the ULTIMATE Guide
description: This ultimate guide demonstrates how to achieve perfect animation retargeting with IK Rigs and IK Retargeter in Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). It covers downloading characters and animations from Mixamo, addressing common problems, converting assets with Blender, and importing them into UE5. The tutorial also explains creating IK Rigs for both Mixamo and Unreal Engine 5 characters, setting up IK Retargeter, modifying poses, adjusting animations with Full Body IK Solver, and adding bone settings.

name: Custom Clothes for Metahuman in Unreal Engine ‚Äî BEGINNER TUTORIAL
description: This beginner tutorial teaches how to add custom clothes to Metahumans using Blender and Unreal Engine. It covers downloading clothes from Sketchfab, exporting Metahuman skeletons from UE5, optionally converting glTF to FBX, merging the Metahuman skeleton with clothes, and importing into Unreal Engine.

name: [üî¥ WEBINAR] Unreal Engine 5 Modeling Tools: Modelando y optimizando modelos dentro de Unreal Engine.
description: This free webinar reviews Unreal Engine 5's Modeling Tools, demonstrating how to model and optimize models directly within the Unreal editor. Michele Bedendo presents the session, which focuses on enhancing 3D modeling workflows.

name: Blueprint Quickshot: Spawning Physics Actors | 04 | v4.7 Tutorial Series | Unreal Engine
description: This video, part 4 of the v4.7 Tutorial Series, explores spawning Actors using Class Blueprints, specifically focusing on physics Actors. It covers physics object creation, spawning them, and creating multiple spawn points.

name: UE5 FREE Clothings for MetaHumans, plus animations!
description: Gabriel Paiva, an authorized Unreal Instructor, presents a video showcasing free clothing options and animations for MetaHumans in UE5. He invites viewers to subscribe for more news and tutorials on Unreal Engine.

name: Making of MetaHuman with AI
description: This video demonstrates the process of creating a MetaHuman with AI, including implementing voice conversations for game characters.

name: [UE5] Mixamo to MetaHumans - UnrealEngine (IK Retargeter)
description: This video demonstrates how to retarget Mixamo animations to MetaHumans in Unreal Engine 5 using the IK Retargeter. It is part of a course available on Gumroad.

name: Tutorial: Crea un metahuman con tu imagen
description: This tutorial explains how to create a Metahuman using your own image, leveraging Epic Games' RealityCapture tool. It covers recording a video with a mobile device, installing the application, importing the video, generating the 3D model, and exporting it.

name: Mixamo - UnrealEngine 5.1
description: This video serves as an inspiration for what can be achieved with Mixamo and Unreal Engine 5.1, rather than a direct tutorial.

name: C√≥mo hacer una gr√°fica de marcadores con iconos en #excel
description: This tutorial teaches how to create a line chart with icon markers in Excel. It invites viewers to support the creator on Patreon and offers information on live training and a platform for online courses.

name: Animating Metahumans in Unreal Engine: Marketplace Animations
description: This video discusses how to use marketplace animations, specifically those with root motion movement, and apply them to Metahumans in Unreal Engine. It references Unreal documentation on retargeting animations to a Metahuman in Unreal Engine 5.

name: Simple Lip Sync Workflow | Metahuman Face Helper v0.1
description: MetaHuman Face Helper v0.1 introduces preset "Phonemes" for quick and intuitive lip sync animation directly within Unreal Engine 5 using Sequencer. The video also mentions the computer hardware used, an HP Z8 Workstation with an Nvidia RTX Quadro 8000.

name: Convai Unreal plug-in quick overview
description: This video provides a quick overview of Convai's Unreal Engine plugin. It guides users to the Convai website to create characters and find the UE plugin. The video also mentions a developer forum for support.

name: Using A Vive Tracker To Control A Virtual Camera in Unreal Engine 5
description: This video provides a detailed walkthrough on using a Vive Tracker to control a virtual camera in Unreal Engine 5. It requires enabling the Live Link XR plugin and mentions an original tutorial for the smoothing script.

name: Set-Up Virtual Camera using VIVE Tracker for Unreal Engine 5. [Easy way]
description: This tutorial demonstrates the easiest way to set up a virtual camera for Unreal Engine 5 using a Vive tracker. It covers connecting the Live Link XR plugin, Vive tracker connection, and configuring the camera to the tracker. The video also references another tutorial on using Vive trackers without a Vive headset.

name: Tutorial 2023: C√≥mo cambiar el l√°ser de tu PlayStation 2 Slim
description: This 2023 tutorial provides a step-by-step guide on how to replace the laser of a PlayStation 2 Slim to resolve disc reading issues. It covers identifying a defective laser, acquiring a compatible replacement, and offers recommendations for tools and safety precautions during the substitution. The tutorial also includes tips for reassembling the console, testing its functionality, and maintaining the new laser.

name: Make Realistic PBR Materials from your Photos FREE! | Materialize
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to create realistic PBR materials from any image or personal photos for free using Materialize. It covers the Diffuse, Height Map, Normal Map, and AO Map sections, along with a bonus tip for height maps and creating tileable textures. The video also shows how to change lighting, save images, and use Quixel Bridge.

name: How to Model in Unreal Engine 5 - Modeling a Japanese Torii
description: This tutorial teaches how to model inside Unreal Engine 5 by creating a Japanese torii. It covers creating and deforming models, using new 5.1 features like the pattern tool and new modeling tools, and gaining a better understanding of in-engine modeling.

name: Free Suit-less Motion Capture | Rokoko A.I.
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to set up and use the new free Rokoko A.I. motion capture tool, which enables suit-less motion capture. It covers footage capture, working with Rokoko Video and Rokoko Studio, and exporting mocap data.

name: Curso Profesores Unreal: Trabajo con Unreal Engine 5.1
description: This video showcases the result of designing an environment in Unreal Engine 5.1, created as part of an Epic Games course for teachers. The development process involved object creation with Reality Capture, lighting, post-processing, Sequencer, Bridge and Megascan. It also included inserting images into objects, creating textures, applying parallax effects for visible rooms from a terrace, architectural design based on real measurements, creating static meshes, using the marketplace for assets, and utilizing the Modeling tool.

name: Capturing Lofoten in Unreal Engine 5
description: This video presents a workflow and process for creating a Lofoten-inspired environment in Unreal Engine 5. It details how the creator built the ocean and mountains, and scanned an old arctic cabin using RealityCapture. The tutorial also touches on lighting, foliage, rendering, and color grading.

name: Why Unreal Engine 5.1 is a Huge Deal
description: This video explains why Unreal Engine 5.1 is a significant update, particularly highlighting the integration of Nanite with foliage. It covers Nanite's capabilities, its application to large forests, and improvements in leaf scattering, glass and water reflections, Lumen, Path Tracing, and GPU Lightmass.

name: How to Start Using Dynamic Runtime TTS in Unreal Engine 5 by ReadSpeaker.AI
description: This video demonstrates how to set up and use ReadSpeaker.ai's Unreal Engine 5 Plugin to integrate cutting-edge AI voices for game development with dynamic runtime Text-to-Speech (TTS). The process shown is also applicable to Unreal Engine 4.

name: Tutorials: How to prepared Demo scene tutorial
description: This tutorial describes how to set up a demo scene using the MetaHuman SDK plugin for Unreal Engine. It details adding Text-to-Speech (TTS) and a voice track, as well as merging everything into a combo request for immersive interaction with a digital human. The MetaHumanSDK also supports interactive chat via Google Dialogflow.

name: Unreal Fest Day 2
description: This video captures presentations from Unreal Fest 2022, featuring talks by top game studios and Epic-hosted sessions. Topics include improving iteration in geo-distributed scenarios, working with data in Unreal Engine 5, building tools with Blueprints, menus, utilities, and widgets, and the transition from proprietary engines to UE5. It also covers 35 lesser-known UE5 features and cross-play/P2P challenges.

name: META HUMANS Lip sync, text to speech and Unreal Engine | Prototype | OVR Oculus Update
description: This video showcases a prototype integrating MetaHumans with lip sync and text-to-speech in Unreal Engine, powered by an OVR Oculus update. The creator acknowledges the assistance from Fractured Fantasy for the MetaHuman chatbot experiment and learning from their videos.

name: How to use chaos in sequencer Unreal Engine5
description: This video guide demonstrates how to get Chaos physics simulations working in Sequencer in Unreal Engine 5.0.2, from simulation to final rendered clip. It uses the Chaos cache manager and player, while acknowledging some unresolved issues, and invites viewers to share alternative methods.

name: ¬°Lleva la destrucci√≥n y el caos a Unreal Engine 5!
description: This video teaches how to prepare objects to fracture and break upon collision in Unreal Engine 5, leveraging the improved "Chaos" destruction features. It demonstrates examples ranging from destroying simple shapes to more complex scenarios where only a part of an imported object can be destroyed. The tutorial also references Unreal Engine's official documentation and a learning path for Chaos Destruction.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Materials Tutorial - A Complete Guide in UE5
description:
This comprehensive tutorial guides beginners on creating materials from scratch in Unreal Engine 5. It covers understanding materials, creating a first material, PBR (Physical Based Rendering) principles, basic math operations, and using textures and masks. The video also delves into Lerps, changing Normal Map intensity, and creating Material Instances for roughness and tiling scale adjustments.

Further, it explores moving UV coordinates, base color tinting, parameter groups, and creating Material Functions for tiling and color tint. The tutorial concludes with Material Layers, Material Layer Blend, grunge texture blending, channel mask parameters, applying master materials to layer assets, changing layer parameters, adding snow with a Slope Mask, refining it, and basic vertex painting for puddles.

name: ¬øC√≥mo hacer un suelo que se rompe en Unreal Engine 5?
description: This video explains how to use Unreal Engine 5's Fracture and Modeling modes to create different states of a tile, demonstrating various stages of deterioration. These generated static mesh objects can be used in any game and are easily integrable with the DBV Universal Platform marketplace asset.

name: #shorts ¬øTe gusta destruir objetos en tus juegos?
description: This short video demonstrates the potential for destroying objects into many pieces upon impact within Unreal Engine 5. A full tutorial on this process will be provided if there is sufficient interest.

name: Mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5 Tutorial - Migrating Field Blueprints
description: This tutorial focuses on mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5, specifically covering the migration of Field Blueprints. It is aimed at game developers and provides resources for learning Game Dev.

name: Mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5 Tutorial - Damage Threshold
description: This tutorial focuses on mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5, specifically covering the concept of Damage Threshold. It aims to help game developers understand and implement destruction mechanics effectively.

name: Mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5 Tutorial - Destruction Theory
description: This tutorial delves into the theory behind mastering Chaos Destruction in Unreal Engine 5. It is designed to help game developers understand the principles of destruction mechanics within the engine.

name: Tutorial: DBV Universal Platform for Unreal Engine 5. How to Use
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to use the DBV Universal Platform in Unreal Engine 5 projects, enabling the creation of platforms that can move, rotate, or balance, similar to a Fall Guys game. It covers setting destination and speed for movement, updating parameters during play in the editor, and exploring various platform examples from the demo level. The Universal Platform can be used as either a C++ object or a blueprint.

name: DBV Universal Platform for Unreal Engine 5. Demo Level (Third Person view)
description: This video showcases the DBV Universal Platform for Unreal Engine 5 from a third-person perspective, highlighting its capability to create various dynamic platforms for games like Fall Guys. It demonstrates platforms that can move, rotate, balance, or break upon interaction. Users can set parameters like maximum distance, destination, velocity, and rotation velocity, with examples of horizontal, vertical, slider, attacking, rotating with obstacles, and combining movements and balance.

name: How I Quickly Create 3D Environments in Unreal Engine 5 | FULL WORKFLOW
description: This video presents a full workflow for quickly creating atmospheric, photorealistic 3D environments in Unreal Engine 5. It covers gathering references, project setup, navigation, camera setup, and environment setup including Mesh Boolean operations. The tutorial also details lighting setup, using foliage assets with a master material for wind, organizing material attributes, painting foliage, and tweaking details. It concludes with high-quality export settings and console variables for optimization.

name: Constructing Destroyed Assets: Creating ‚ÄòNinety Days‚Äô in Unreal Engine 5
description: This video by Quixel's Jakob Keudel demonstrates his approach to constructing destroyed buildings and environments for the 'Ninety Days' showcase video using Unreal Engine 5. He details how collapsed and broken structures were built entirely within Unreal Engine, leveraging its geometry and fracturing tools along with Megascans surface scans. The tutorial specifically focuses on creating broken floor modules and other destroyed building pieces without leaving the engine.

name: DBV Universal Platform for Unreal Engine 5. Demo Level (Flying view)
description: This video showcases the DBV Universal Platform for Unreal Engine 5 from a flying perspective, illustrating its capability to instantly create various dynamic platforms for games like Fall Guys. It demonstrates platforms that can move, rotate, or balance, as well as those that break upon impact. Users can update parameters such as maximum distance, destination, velocity, and rotation velocity during play.

name: Blueprints Tutorial ## - DOCUMENTACION OFICIAL - Como Usar Unreal Engine Espa√±ol
description: This tutorial teaches how to use Unreal Engine by drawing on official documentation, presented in Spanish. It invites users to join a Facebook group and Discord community for support, and references playlists for Unreal tutorials, FPS game creation, and free marketplace assets.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Tutorial - UE5 Starter Course
description: This free Unreal Engine 5 tutorial for beginners covers everything needed to get started, with a focus on Nanite and Lumen. It guides users through installing Unreal Engine, navigating the 3D viewport, creating materials and worlds, sculpting landscapes, and painting foliage. The tutorial also includes programming with Blueprints and creating a photorealistic world in real-time, concluding with a demonstration of a modular castle and optimization tips.

name: Unbox Therapy reviews the Lume Pad
description: Unbox Therapy reviews the Lume Pad, highlighting it as the world's first 3D Lightfield tablet. It showcases the tablet's ability to play Hollywood blockbusters in 3D, convert 2D content (photos, Twitch streams) to 3D in real-time, and offer immersive 3D gaming without glasses.

name: Blockout and Asset Production in UE5 | Feature Highlight | State of Unreal 2022
description: This evangelism talk from State of Unreal 2022 provides a primer on Unreal Engine 5's new and improved geometry tools for 3D modeling and asset production. It demonstrates the process of creating a scene from scratch, from blocking out to populating it with packed level instances and dynamic meshes made with geometry script.

name: Upgrading your UE4 Project to UE5 | Feature Highlight | State of Unreal 2022
description: This evangelism talk from State of Unreal 2022 assists developers in deciding whether to upgrade their Unreal Engine 4 projects to Unreal Engine 5. It provides examples of the upgrade process, advice on overcoming potential issues, and explains how content may change during the transition.

name: Your First Game in UE5 | Tech Talk | State of Unreal 2022
description: This tech talk from State of Unreal 2022 offers a practical, in-editor demonstration for beginners on how to start making a game from scratch in Unreal Engine 5. It highlights UE5 features and shows how quickly a game can be created by leveraging new and established engine functionalities. The demo uses assets from the Stack-O-Bot project on the Unreal Marketplace.

name: üíé UNREAL ENGINE 5 üíé para principiantes | UE5 preview 2 | ARCHVIZ | TUTORIAL render Arquitectura
description: This tutorial explores Unreal Engine 5 preview 2 for architectural visualization, demonstrating how easy it is for beginners to create renders. It covers installation, importing models, basic lighting, cameras, using Quixel Megascans, foliage scattering, and placing individual assets. The video also touches on fog adjustments, post-process volumes, point lights, creating night scenes, and rendering videos.

name: Unreal Engine 5 - How To Create Cinematics in Sequencer Tutorial
description: This tutorial covers everything needed to produce cinematics in Sequencer within Unreal Engine 5 or 4. It guides users through using Sequencer, camera and object workflows, and creating scenes via animation, blueprint, or Sequencer itself. The video also explains the Curve Editor, slow motion, fade in/out effects, character movement, root motion, and rendering techniques, including a crucial warning for users.

name: Tutorial: Blender Cloth Sewing - Basic Shirt
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to create a basic shirt in Blender using Cloth Sewing Physics.

name: Custom Metahuman, clothing & face using Quixel Mixer - Unreal Engine Tutorial
description: This tutorial shows how to customize Metahuman assets, including clothing and face, using only Quixel Mixer and Unreal Engine. It covers altering existing clothing and face assets, setting up the project in Unreal Engine, and exporting texture files to Quixel Mixer. The video also explains importing and exporting FBX models, basic Quixel Mixer controls, coloring clothing, using texture masks, painting textures on meshes, importing custom brushes, and customizing Metahuman heads. It concludes with manually loading texture files into Unreal and manipulating materials for fine-tuning, including creating emissive effects for the Metahuman face.

name: Tutorial: Sewing Cloth In Blender | Beginners
description: This tutorial teaches beginners how to use Blender's cloth sewing feature (in Blender 2.92) to create clothing, specifically demonstrating how to make a 60s-style dress.

name: How To Create A Main Menu - Unreal Engine 4 Tutorial
description: This Unreal Engine 4 tutorial demonstrates how to create a main menu for games. It covers designing the menu and implementing its functionality, such as navigating between different widgets/menus and starting or quitting the game.

name: Unreal Engine 4: Antorcha Sistema de Part√≠culas (Espa√±ol)
description: This tutorial (in Spanish) demonstrates how to create a torch particle system in Unreal Engine 4. Users can download the particle system to integrate into their projects.

name: Unreal Engine 4: ¬°Env√≠a tu juego! Empaquetar proyecto
description: This video shows how to package an Unreal Engine 4 project for distribution. It also invites users to submit their games for a channel compilation and gameplay analysis.

name: Unreal Engine 4: Cinem√°ticas y secuencias (espa√±ol)
description: This tutorial teaches how to create cinematics and sequences in Unreal Engine 4, export them as AVI, and play them within projects.

name: Unreal Engine 4 Chroma Keyer tutorial
description: This is a tutorial on how to use the Chroma Keyer in Unreal Engine 4.

name: Basic Keying Realtime Video onto Geometry in Unreal Engine for Virtual Production
description: This video outlines a basic approach to keying real-time video onto geometry in Unreal Engine for virtual production, also applicable to video files or still images. It covers creating a master material from a texture, converting it into a material parameter, and adding MF_Chromakeyer. The tutorial emphasizes different Blend Mode options for transparency support and creating a Material Instance for keying parameters.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Tutorial - UE5 Starter Course!
description:
This updated Unreal Engine 5 tutorial is for beginners, covering everything needed to get started with a focus on Nanite and Lumen. It guides users through installing Unreal Engine, navigating the 3D viewport, creating materials and worlds, sculpting landscapes, and painting foliage.

The tutorial also includes programming with Blueprints and creating a photorealistic world in real-time, demonstrating how to set up a creek project, light an open world, sculpt rivers with water, paint trees, and build a modular castle. It concludes with adding small details, optimization tips, and final adjustments.

name: Realtime 3D Video Production is here! (Unreal Engine Tutorial)
description: This tutorial demonstrates real-time 3D video production using Unreal Engine, showcasing a workflow that includes real-time green keying and live camera tracking within a self-built virtual environment. It aims to help users master filmmaking, video editing, and VFX.

name: Unreal Engine ~ How to Setup an iPad as a Virtual Camera using the Live Link VCAM app
description: This video demonstrates how to set up and use an iPad (or iPhone) as a Virtual Camera in Unreal Engine using the Live Link VCAM app, making virtual production much easier. The creator plans to share more results, especially in Unreal Engine 5. The tutorial highlights that Unreal Engine 5 empowers artists with unprecedented detail and interactivity through productive tools and content libraries.

name: Tutorial: Place yourself into an Unreal Engine environment with green screen
description: This tutorial explains how to place yourself into an Unreal Engine environment using a green screen. It references an ArchViz Interior project available through the Epic Games Launcher and provides links for video conversion.

name: In depth Tutorial - Virtual Production with Unreal Engine and HTC Vive
description: This in-depth tutorial covers virtual production in Unreal Engine with HTC Vive, recorded in late 2019. It delves into the setup of virtual sets using Aximmetry software, noting that most facilities already have the necessary hardware. The video also mentions tracking solutions like Antilatency and Glassmark Encoders.

name: Tutorial RTSP Livestream Media in Unreal Engine 4
description: This tutorial covers RTSP livestream media integration in Unreal Engine 4.

name: Croma AVANZADO en Unreal Engine | Especial 10.000 SUSCRIPTORES
description: This video celebrates reaching 10,000 subscribers by demonstrating advanced chroma keying techniques in Unreal Engine, allowing users to integrate themselves into 3D worlds. The tutorial aims to provide entertainment and valuable knowledge on virtual production.

name: Calibrate Metahuman and Live Link Face the right way - Virtual Production Tutorial 16
description: This tutorial shows how to properly calibrate a Metahuman's face to work with a user's own face for Live Link animation, avoiding common issues like the mouth not closing. It allows for a better match or exaggeration of motions. The video covers setting up Live Link animation, capturing a neutral pose, modifying the animation blueprint, and trying out changes. It emphasizes the importance of acting and looking into the camera during mocap.

name: Educator‚Äôs Field Guide | Unreal Educator Livestream
description: This livestream, part of the Educator‚Äôs Field Guide, features Luis Cataldi exploring the free Epic resources available to help teach Unreal Engine in schools, online, or within studios. It also highlights favorite community resources that have inspired and educated the Epic Games team. The session aims to equip educators and learners with essential resources for teaching Unreal Engine.

name: iClone MetaHuman Live Link Part 4: Full Character Animation & Recording in UE4
description: This video, part 4 of the iClone MetaHuman Live Link series, explores full character animation and recording in Unreal Engine 4. It demonstrates how to stream both body and facial animation simultaneously from iClone into Unreal Engine via Live Link for full motion performance. The tutorial also covers recording animations using Take Recorder and troubleshooting common issues when animating MetaHuman characters with Live Link.

name: My Rokoko MOCAP Guide for Unreal Engine and MetaHumans
description: This video outlines a process for offline Motion Capture/Performance Capture using the Rokoko Smart Suit, Smart Gloves, and Rokoko Studio. It covers rendering, retargeting, and MOCAP editing within Unreal Engine 4.26 and UE5. The video was originally produced for the Citizen Meta One YouTube channel.

name: Opening a Door in Car Configurators | Tips & Tricks | Unreal Engine
description: This Unreal Tips & Tricks video demonstrates how to use Sequencer and Blueprints to create simple interactions, such as opening a car door, in car configurators. It explains setting up animation with keyframes in Sequencer and triggering that animation via a Blueprint, outlining a workflow applicable for building UI systems.

name: Create a virtual set in 15 minutes, step by step demo by Jamie I Aximmetry DE
description: This step-by-step demo by Jamie Pence showcases how to easily and cost-effectively set up a virtual set in 15 minutes using Aximmetry DE software. It demonstrates incorporating existing hardware (camera, capture card, PC) and a green screen to create a virtual studio production, suitable for both novice and professional users.

name: Blurring the line between virtual production and game dev | Inside Unreal
description: Alvaro Garcia Martinez discusses his transition from traditional filmmaking to real-time technology for his projects, blurring the lines between virtual production and game development. He shares practical examples for character animation, retargeting, MetaHuman stylization, and world building with Houdini. The session also provides tips focused on enhancing creativity in both filmmaking and game development.

name: Unreal Engine 5 - Create a Beach in 1.5 mins
description: This quick tutorial demonstrates how to create a beach landscape in Unreal Engine 5 in 1.5 minutes using the new water body features.

name: Multi-User Editing | Live from HQ | Inside Unreal
description: This livestream demonstrates how to get started with Multi-User Editing in Unreal Engine, exploring its cinematic content pipeline. It explains how to connect multiple instances of Unreal Editor for collaborative real-time work in a shared virtual world. The session also includes news on Unreal Engine training and community spotlights.

name: iPhone Facial Capture with Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Online 2020
description: This talk by Epic Games' Ryan Mayeda demonstrates how Live Link Face for Unreal Engine, an iOS app, streams high-quality facial expressions from an iPhone's True Depth camera and ARKit to characters in Unreal Engine in real time. It covers advanced virtual production topics like multicast networking for multi-user workflows, timecode support for synchronization, remote control with OSC, and data management for recordings. This is beneficial for animators, stage operators, and streamers.

name: Evolving Animating with Unreal Engine | GDC 2021
description: Jeremiah Grant, Technical Product Manager at Epic Games, demonstrates how to leverage new workflows and rigging/animation authoring tools in Unreal Engine, including Control Rig and Sequencer. The focus is on enabling artists to work in context, minimizing the need to switch between software packages for faster iteration within Unreal Engine.

name: Star Wars Fan Film Contest 2021
description: This video announces the Star Wars Fan Film Contest 2021, celebrating the channel's 5-year anniversary by showcasing and rewarding other Star Wars Fan Film creators. It encourages aspiring filmmakers to participate, outlining contest details, rules, and prizes. The video also lists resources like a filmmaking course and free software access to assist participants.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Tutorial | Nordic Beach Environment
description: This Unreal Engine 5 tutorial for beginners teaches how to create a Nordic beach environment using landscape tools and Quixel Megascans. It covers setting up Directional Light, Sky Light (Lumen), Sky Atmosphere, rotating the sun, Exponential Height Fog, Volumetric Clouds, Volumetric Fog, and Post Process Volume. The tutorial also includes auto exposure, landscape creation with material, using the water plugin to create an ocean, and adding Quixel Megascans assets.

name: Custom Clothing (with Physics) for Metahuman in Unreal Engine
description: This video demonstrates the complete workflow for creating a dress for a naked Metahuman character and applying physics to it within Unreal Engine. The final results are shown in a separate video.

name: UE4 - Meta Human - New Cloth
description: This video shows new cloth features for MetaHumans in Unreal Engine 4.

name: iClone MetaHuman Live Link Part 2: Facial & Lipsync Animation for UE4
description: This tutorial, part 2 of the iClone MetaHuman Live Link series, covers facial and lipsync animation for UE4. It demonstrates animating MetaHuman characters' faces in Unreal using iClone motion tools with the Live Link plug-in. The video also offers tips for optimizing the connection between iClone and Unreal for smoother operation.

name: Animate MetaHumans Face, Body, Voice Lip-Sync in ONE Application - iClone MetaHuman Live Link
description: This video showcases the iClone MetaHuman Live Link, a solution for efficiently animating MetaHumans' faces, bodies, and voice lip-sync within a single application. It addresses the challenge of bringing MetaHumans to life for rapid production without compromising realism.

name: Desaf√≠o Empresas Andalucia 2010. Los 3 d√≠as.
description: This video features footage from the 2010 Desaf√≠o Empresas Andaluc√≠a, a three-day competition for companies with teams of four people, held in M√°laga. The event focused on team-building, leadership, and innovative management in a unique environment. It successfully motivated participants and fostered connections between different economic sectors.

name: How to use the NewTek NDI SDK & Unreal Engine (UE4) to composite real-time green screen footage (4K)
description: This step-by-step demonstration shows how to composite real-time green screen footage in Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) using the NewTek NDI SDK. It covers chroma-keying in OBS and pushing the footage through the network via the NDI protocol to UE4 for virtual production workflows. The method offers a free and effective solution for real-time compositing, acknowledging NDI as a powerful protocol.

name: Unreal Engine 4 Ipad
description: This video demonstrates how to use an iPad as a virtual camera in Unreal Engine 4 and 5. It covers setting up the iPad for virtual production within Unreal Engine. The creator also promotes their courses on filmmaking in Unreal Engine.

name: Quick test using billboards | Aximmetry
description: This video showcases a quick test using billboards in Aximmetry.

name: Using an iPhone as a tracker for Virtual Production
description: This video explores using an iPhone as a tracker for a live-action camera within Unreal Engine for virtual production. It provides a step-by-step experimental guide to setting up this functionality. While the setup works to some degree, it still requires tweaking for production viability.

name: Motion Warping and Full-Body IK | Inside Unreal
description: This Inside Unreal session explores Unreal Engine 5‚Äôs new animation features: Full-Body IK (FBIK) and Motion Warping. FBIK provides tools for creating reactive, dynamic characters, while Motion Warping is an experimental feature allowing manipulation of root motion animations to adapt to the world with fewer custom assets.

name: MR Factory Brings Virtual Production to the Studio | Project Spotlight | Unreal Engine
description: This project spotlight features MR Factory, a high-end production studio, explaining how they produce entire films in-house using a green screen, Brainstorm's virtual studio engine, and live 3D backgrounds from Unreal Engine. This virtual production setup saves time, fosters creativity, and opens new possibilities for filmmakers.

name: Work-From-Home Virtual Production | Unreal Fest Online 2020
description: In this session, Cinematographer and Developer Matt Workman details how he established an indie virtual production studio at home using a mix of real-world camera equipment and Unreal Engine. He shares insights into his remote collaboration workflows, beneficial for live-action filmmakers and VFX/3D artists interested in virtual production.

name: Create Accurate, Natural, and Smooth Lipsync Animations with AccuLips | iClone
description: This video explores AccuLips in iClone, highlighting its intuitive method for generating procedural, editable lipsyncing animations that are accurate, natural, and smooth. It covers detecting and generating precise text and visemes from audio, making characters speak realistically, and utilizing 16 talking styles designed for various situations.

name: Real-time Compositing in Unreal Engine Virtual Production
description: This video showcases real-time compositing for virtual production in Unreal Engine, filmed at MR Factory Madrid. It demonstrates solutions for real-time virtual production compositing.

name: Formidable girls and metahuman tests powered by Aximmetry
description: This video showcases MetaHuman tests featuring 'formidable girls', powered by Aximmetry. The content is credited to FUNTOO.

name: Tutorial UE4: Meta-Humans. Captura facial con iPhone, FaceLink, Take Recorder y Sequencer
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to use Meta-Humans in Unreal Engine 4, focusing on facial capture with an iPhone and FaceLink. It covers loading the Meta-Humans test project, configuring the iPhone and LiveLinkFace, and recording animations with Take Recorder. The video also shows how to create a sequence in Sequencer, add audio, animate cameras, edit the scene, and render with audio, using a dialogue from 'The Empire Strikes Back'.

name: How to change the body of a Metahuman | Metahuman Tutorial | Put a Metahuman in a spacesuit |
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to change a Metahuman's body and put a Metahuman head on any existing skeleton or body, such as placing a Metahuman in a spacesuit. It covers using NASA 3D assets, setting up the MissionAR project, removing the head from a skeletal mesh, and exporting/importing the Metahuman from Quixel Bridge. The video also explains creating the Metahuman blueprint, retargeting animations from the default mannequin, creating a spacesuit helmet using Blender, attaching a static mesh (helmet) to the head via sockets, fixing normals and holes, and setting up the Third Person Character.

name: UE Take Recorder Live Link Source & Control Rig Backward Additive Solver
description: This video explains how to record Live Link Source data from the UE Live Link Face in Take Recorder to get cleaner facial motion capture data on new Metahumans. It also demonstrates using the new Control Rig Additive Backward Solver to fine-tune or add animations to recordings in Unreal Engine. The content was created using a Razer Blade 15 Studio Edition laptop with NVIDIACreator graphics.

name: Simple Beginner Tutorial UNREAL Metahuman and Live Link (Face and Head recognition)
description: This simple beginner tutorial guides users through integrating MetaHuman samples and the Live Link plugin in Unreal Engine, focusing on face and head recognition. It covers project creation, adjusting computer settings, changing viewport focus, and setting up Live Link for face and head recognition. The video also provides alternative access to the MetaHuman Sample Project for learning purposes.

name: UNREAL MetaHuman Android or Webcam Face Recognition (non-free Live Link Alternative) Tutorial
description: This Unreal tutorial offers an alternative to the iPhone Live Link for MetaHuman face recognition, working with Android, PC, or pre-recorded video. It demonstrates a MetaHuman on Android, explains how the system works, and introduces Mocap Software (Freeware Studio) and its Unreal Plugin (Glassbox's Live Client). The tutorial also covers using Android Cam to Window (DroidCam), Faceware configurations, and setting up Faceware with a Metahuman project.

name: Lip sync in Unreal Engine [TUTORIAL]
description: This tutorial explains how to implement lip sync in Unreal Engine. It provides project files and references other tutorials for lip sync in UE4, as well as tools like PocketSphinx, Rhubarb, and Sox.

name: Unreal Engine 4.26 Water Tutorial
description: This tutorial explores the new Water System in Unreal Engine 4.26, showing which parameters to modify for desired looks. It covers using new river and lake tools and setting up buoyancy for actors like boats.

name: How to animate a 3D METAHUMAN
description: This tutorial shows how to animate a 3D Metahuman. It is the creator's first detailed tutorial, aiming to help viewers bring their Metahumans to life.

name: Unreal Engine Metahuman Change Clothes
description: This tutorial demonstrates how to change Metahuman clothes in Unreal Engine 4.26. It covers swapping clothes, using the Metahuman Creator, and integrating with perception neuron. The creator also promotes their courses on filmmaking in Unreal Engine.
